summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan scheduling a telephone conference for jury selection matters in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case. It provides public access information for the audio feed of the proceeding and outlines prohibitions against recording or rebroadcasting.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the court order.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the order scheduling the telephone conference and setting the rules for public access.

events.title: Jury Selection Telephone Conference
events.description: The court schedules a telephone conference to discuss jury selection matters for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The court scheduled a telephone conference for October 21, 2021, to discuss jury selection in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The public and press were granted access to a live audio feed of the proceeding via a provided phone number and access code.
The order explicitly prohibits photographing, recording, or rebroadcasting the court proceedings, with potential fines or sanctions for violations.
Counsel, the defendant, alleged victims, and family members were to receive a separate, additional dial-in number for the conference.
